Song.title: It Came Upon A Midnight Clear
Song.copyright: Words by Ed­mund Sears Music by Ri­chard Wil­lis Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: It [C]came u[F]pon a [C]midnight clear, That [F]glorious [D7]song of [G7]old, From [C]angels [F]bending [C]near the earth, To [F]touch their [G7]harps of [C]gold; “Peace [E7]on the earth, good [Am]will to men, From [G]Heaven’s all-[D7]gracious [G]King.” [G/F] The [C/E]world in [F]solemn [C/G]stillness [C]lay, To [F]hear the [G7]angels [C]sing.
Verse 2: Still [C]through the [F]cloven [C]skies they come With [F]peaceful [D7]wings un[G7]furled, And [C]still their [F]heavenly [C]music floats O’er [F]all the [G7]weary [C]world; A[E7]bove its sad and [Am]lowly plains, They [G]bend on [D7]hovering [G]wing, [G/F] And [C/E]ever [F]o’er its [C/G]Babel [C]sounds The [F]blessèd [G7]angels [C]sing.
{new_page} Verse 3: And [C]ye, be[F]neath life’s [C]crushing load, Whose [F]forms are [D7]bending [G7]low, Who [C]toil a[F]long the [C]climbing way With [F]painful [G7]steps and [C]slow, Look [E7]now! for glad and [Am]golden hours Come [G]swiftly [D7]on the [G]wing. [G/F] O [C/E]rest be[F]side the [C/G]weary [C]road, And [F]hear the [G7]angels [C]sing!
Verse 4: For [C]lo! the [F]days are [C]hastening on, By [F]prophet-[D7]bards fore[G7]told, When [C]with the [F]ever-[C]circling years Comes [F]round the [G7]age of [C]gold; When [E7]peace shall over [Am]all the earth Its [G]ancient [D7]splendors [G]fling, [G/F] And [C/E]the whole [F]world send [C/G]back the [C]song Which [F]now the [G7]angels [C]sing.
